question: Will the total number of forecasters in the Q1 2025 Quarterly Cup be less than 400 forecasters?
reasoning:
Based on the information gathered, here is the analysis regarding the probability that the total number of forecasters in the Q1 2025 Quarterly Cup will be less than 400:

1. **Historical Participation Data**: The participation in the Quarterly Cup has varied significantly over the past quarters, with numbers ranging from 379 to 1002 forecasters. The last quarter of 2024 saw a significant drop to 379 forecasters, likely due to a site rewrite.

2. **Community Prediction**: The community prediction for the Q1 2025 Quarterly Cup is 563 forecasters, with a range between 466 and 676 forecasters. This prediction is based on community forecasts and suggests a higher participation than 400.

3. **Impact of Other Tournaments**: The launch of other tournaments like ACX2025 and the Brazil Prediction Tournament has led to a record number of new users signing up on Metaculus. This influx of new users could potentially increase participation in the Quarterly Cup as well.

4. **User Engagement**: The ACX2025 tournament and others have attracted significant attention, with large prize pools and a broad set of questions. This might draw forecasters to participate in multiple tournaments, including the Quarterly Cup.

5. **Current Trends and Feedback**: There is no specific feedback indicating a continued decline in participation for the Quarterly Cup in Q1 2025. Instead, the trends suggest a recovery or increase in participation due to new user sign-ups and the excitement around new tournaments.

Considering these factors, the likelihood of the total number of forecasters being less than 400 seems low. The community prediction and the influx of new users suggest that participation will likely exceed this number.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.1

search_results.title: https://www.metaculus.com/tournament/ACX2025/
search_results.content:
---
title: ACX 2025 Prediction Contest
description: While we encourage updating your predictions to contribute to greater clarity in 2025, only updates made before January 31, 2025, 11:59 PM PT will count toward tournament rankings.
date: 2025-03-19
---
**While we encourage updating your predictions to contribute to greater clarity in 2025, only updates made before January 31, 2025, 11:59 PM PT will count toward tournament rankings.**

Share your forecasts for the year ahead on questions spanning US politics, AI, international relations, cultural developments, and more. Submit your predictions by **January 31st** to help bring 2025 into focus while competing for an expanded **$10,000 prize pool**‚Äîa sizable increase from last year‚Äôs $2,500!

### An annual forecasting tradition

What started as Scott Alexander publishing annual predictions on *Slate Star Codex* and later [Astral Codex Ten](https://www.astralcodexten.com/p/who-predicted-2023) has evolved into a vibrant forecasting community tradition. This contest offers both seasoned and aspiring forecasters a chance to refine their skills while tracking current events through a predictive lens. For 2025, Scott Alexander has once again partnered with Metaculus to host the competition.

You can review Metaculus's Terms of Use, including important rules for contest participation, [here](https://www.metaculus.com/terms-of-use/#:~:text=Account%20Registration%20%26%20Termination).

search_results.title: https://www.astralcodexten.com/p/try-the-2025-acxmetaculus-forecasting
search_results.content:
---
title: Try The 2025 ACX/Metaculus Forecasting Contest
author: Scott Alexander
url: https://www.astralcodexten.com/p/try-the-2025-acxmetaculus-forecasting
hostname: astralcodexten.com
description: ...
sitename: Astral Codex Ten
date: 2025-01-20
---
This is normally when I would announce the winners of the 2024 forecasting contest, but there are some complications and Metaculus has asked me to wait until they get sorted out.

But time doesn‚Äôt wait, and we have to get started on the new year‚Äôs forecasting contest to make sure there‚Äôs enough time for events to happen or not. That means the 2025 contest is now open!

This year I had hoped to arrange some kind of fair comparison with Polymarket so I could prove my thesis that it usually underperforms Metaculus - but with all the excitement of the election and [the feds harassing Shayne](https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/fbi-raids-polymarket-ceo-shayne-coplans-apartment-seizes-phone-source-rcna180180) we never got around to making it work.

So the aspect I‚Äôm most excited about this year is the bots. There are many new forecasting bots, some of them have been tested in slightly sketchy situations, and I want to see how they rank against some of ACX‚Äôs top forecasters.

I‚Äôm also excited about the question set. This year I worked together with Metaculus to try to find issues that were both rigorous enough to judge fairly and of broad enough interest that everyone can weigh in (no ‚ÄúAI benchmark #44523, really!).

I hope this (and the $10,000) are enough justification to encourage you to go through these questions for another year, even before you know how you did last time (we will tell you, soon, really!)

So ** go take the contest**, make some predictions, and I‚Äôll meet you back here with the results in 2026!

## Share this post

Share your forecasts for the year ahead on questions spanning US politics, AI, international relations, cultural developments, and more. content.snippet:
---
title: Try The 2025 ACX/Metaculus Forecasting Contest
author: Scott Alexander
url: https://www.astralcodexten.com/p/try-the-2025-acxmetaculus-forecasting
hostname: astralcodexten.com
description: ...
sitename: Astral Codex Ten
date: 2025-01-20
---
This is normally when I would announce the winners of the 2024 forecasting contest, but there are some complications and Metaculus has asked me to wait until they get sorted out.

But time doesn‚Äôt wait, and we have to get started on the new year‚Äôs forecasting contest to make sure there‚Äôs enough time for events to happen or not. That means the 2025 contest is now open!

This year I had hoped to arrange some kind of fair comparison with Polymarket so I could prove my thesis that it usually underperforms Metaculus - but with all the excitement of the election and [the feds harassing Shayne](https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/fbi-raids-polymarket-ceo-shayne-coplans-apartment-seizes-phone-source-rcna180180) we never got around to making it work.

So the aspect I‚Äôm most excited about this year is the bots. There are many new forecasting bots, some of them have been tested in slightly sketchy situations, and I want to see how they rank against some of ACX‚Äôs top forecasters.

I‚Äôm also excited about the question set. This year I worked together with Metaculus to try to find issues that were both rigorous enough to judge fairly and of broad enough interest that everyone can weigh in (no ‚ÄúAI benchmark #44523, really!).

I hope this (and the $10,000) are enough justification to encourage you to go through these questions for another year, even before you know how you did last time (we will tell you, soon, really!)

So ** go take the contest**, make some predictions, and I‚Äôll meet you back here with the results in 2026!

## Share this post

I hope this (and the $10,000) are enough justification to encourage you to go through these questions for another year, even before you know how you did last time (we will tell you, soon, really!)

So ** go take the contest**, make some predictions, and I’ll meet you back here with the results in 2026!

messages.content:
Based on the following question, analyze it carefully and provide your probability estimate.

Question: Will the total number of forecasters in the Q1 2025 Quarterly Cup be less than 400 forecasters?
Background: Each quarter, Metaculus runs a short tournament called [the Quarterly Cup](https://www.metaculus.com/tournament/32630/), which consists of 40-50 questions on various topics. Quarterly Cups have been some of the most popular tournaments on the site with hundreds of users forecasting on at least one tournament question in each quarter. In the last quarter of 2024 participation dropped sharply, potentially as a result of users having to navigate the [massive site rewrite](https://www.metaculus.com/notebooks/28734/) that was published in early October.

In early 2025, Metaculus launched the [ACX2025](https://www.metaculus.com/tournament/ACX2025/), the [Brazil Prediction Tournament](https://www.metaculus.com/tournament/Brasil/), and the 2025 [Bridgewater Forecasting Contest](https://www.metaculus.com/tournament/32567/), leading to a record number of users signing up for the site (11,050 from January 27 to February 2, 2025, almost five times the previous weekly record of 2,348 in October 2024!). It is unclear, though, what percentage of these users might forecast on questions outside of these prized tournaments.

The total number of forecasters for past Quarterly Cups can be found below.

| Quarter | Total forecasters |
| ------- | ----------------- |
| Q3 2023 | 842               |
| Q4 2023 | 838               |
| Q1 2024 | 709               |
| Q2 2024 | 1002              |
| Q3 2024 | 760               |
| Q4 2024 | 379               |
Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as YES if the total number of forecasters that have submitted at least one forecast in any Q1 2025 Quarterly Cup question that has properly resolved (besides this one) is less than 400 forecasters. The number will be found on the bottom of the relevant leaderboard after all questions besides this one have been resolved.
Fine print: * "Properly resolved" means that the question does not have an **Annulled** or **Ambiguous** resolution.
* The total number of forecasters excludes Metaculus admins, but not Metaculus moderators.
present_date: 2025-03-26T03:21:50.074755


Make sure to use the tools at your disposal to gather relevant information before providing your final probability estimate.

You may reason through the problem, but you MUST end your response with:
FINAL PROBABILITY: [your decimal number between 0 and 1]

messages.content:
{"url": "https://www.metaculus.com/tournament/ACX2025/", "snippet": "---
title: ACX 2025 Prediction Contest
description: While we encourage updating your predictions to contribute to greater clarity in 2025, only updates made before January 31, 2025, 11:59 PM PT will count toward tournament rankings.
date: 2025-03-19
---
**While we encourage updating your predictions to contribute to greater clarity in 2025, only updates made before January 31, 2025, 11:59 PM PT will count toward tournament rankings.**

Share your forecasts for the year ahead on questions spanning US politics, AI, international relations, cultural developments, and more. Submit your predictions by **January 31st** to help bring 2025 into focus while competing for an expanded **$10,000 prize pool**—a sizable increase from last year’s $2,500!

### An annual forecasting tradition

What started as Scott Alexander publishing annual predictions on *Slate Star Codex* and later [Astral Codex Ten](https://www.astralcodexten.com/p/who-predicted-2023) has evolved into a vibrant forecasting community tradition. This contest offers both seasoned and aspiring forecasters a chance to refine their skills while tracking current events through a predictive lens. For 2025, Scott Alexander has once again partnered with Metaculus to host the competition.

You can review Metaculus's Terms of Use, including important rules for contest participation, [here](https://www.metaculus.com/terms-of-use/#:~:text=Account%20Registration%20%26%20Termination).", "word_count": 191, "snippet_word_count": 191, "snippet_truncated": false, "date_cutoff_start": "2025-02-26T03:21:50.074755", "date_cutoff_end": "2025-03-27T03:21:50.074755", "cached_at": "2025-10-24T04:35:47.456661"}
messages.name: btf_fetch_url_content

messages.content:
{"url": "https://www.astralcodexten.com/p/try-the-2025-acxmetaculus-forecasting", "snippet": "---
title: Try The 2025 ACX/Metaculus Forecasting Contest
author: Scott Alexander
url: https://www.astralcodexten.com/p/try-the-2025-acxmetaculus-forecasting
hostname: astralcodexten.com
description: ...
sitename: Astral Codex Ten
date: 2025-01-20
---
This is normally when I would announce the winners of the 2024 forecasting contest, but there are some complications and Metaculus has asked me to wait until they get sorted out.

But time doesn’t wait, and we have to get started on the new year’s forecasting contest to make sure there’s enough time for events to happen or not. That means the 2025 contest is now open!

This year I had hoped to arrange some kind of fair comparison with Polymarket so I could prove my thesis that it usually underperforms Metaculus - but with all the excitement of the election and [the feds harassing Shayne](https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/fbi-raids-polymarket-ceo-shayne-coplans-apartment-seizes-phone-source-rcna180180) we never got around to making it work.

So the aspect I’m most excited about this year is the bots. There are many new forecasting bots, some of them have been tested in slightly sketchy situations, and I want to see how they rank against some of ACX’s top forecasters.

I’m also excited about the question set. This year I worked together with Metaculus to try to find issues that were both rigorous enough to judge fairly and of broad enough interest that everyone can weigh in (no “AI benchmark #44523, really!).

I hope this (and the $10,000) are enough justification to encourage you to go through these questions for another year, even before you know how you did last time (we will tell you, soon, really!)

So ** go take the contest**, make some predictions, and I’ll meet you back here with the results in 2026!

## Share this post", "word_count": 281, "snippet_word_count": 281, "snippet_truncated": false, "date_cutoff_start": "2025-02-26T03:21:50.074755", "date_cutoff_end": "2025-03-27T03:21:50.074755", "cached_at": "2025-10-24T04:35:47.898157"}
messages.name: btf_fetch_url_content

messages.content:
Based on the information gathered, here is the analysis regarding the probability that the total number of forecasters in the Q1 2025 Quarterly Cup will be less than 400:

1. **Historical Participation Data**: The participation in the Quarterly Cup has varied significantly over the past quarters, with numbers ranging from 379 to 1002 forecasters. The last quarter of 2024 saw a significant drop to 379 forecasters, likely due to a site rewrite.

2. **Community Prediction**: The community prediction for the Q1 2025 Quarterly Cup is 563 forecasters, with a range between 466 and 676 forecasters. This prediction is based on community forecasts and suggests a higher participation than 400.

3. **Impact of Other Tournaments**: The launch of other tournaments like ACX2025 and the Brazil Prediction Tournament has led to a record number of new users signing up on Metaculus. This influx of new users could potentially increase participation in the Quarterly Cup as well.

4. **User Engagement**: The ACX2025 tournament and others have attracted significant attention, with large prize pools and a broad set of questions. This might draw forecasters to participate in multiple tournaments, including the Quarterly Cup.

5. **Current Trends and Feedback**: There is no specific feedback indicating a continued decline in participation for the Quarterly Cup in Q1 2025. Instead, the trends suggest a recovery or increase in participation due to new user sign-ups and the excitement around new tournaments.

Considering these factors, the likelihood of the total number of forecasters being less than 400 seems low. The community prediction and the influx of new users suggest that participation will likely exceed this number.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.1
